Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Reverend Henry T. Simmons, United Chirch of Christ, 172-17 Linden Boulevard, St. Albans, Queens, NY 11434.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Comrie.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Reverend Henry T. Simmons, United Church of Christ, 172-17 Linden Boulevard, St. Albans, Queens, N.Y. 11434. 

Council Member Comrie moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 13, 2010 be adopted as printed by Council Member Lander.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Lander moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 13, 2010 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the maintenance of vacant buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Maintenance of vacant buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing on-site disposal of storm water runoff to improve the quality of New York city waters and enhance the potential for recreational use of the city's waterfronts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Allowing on-site disposal of storm water runoff to improve the quality of NYC waters and enhance the potential for recreational use of the city's waterfronts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact A. 11465/S.8174, an act to amend the real property actions and proceedings law, in relation to standing to commence an action to foreclose a mortgage.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Standing to commence an action to foreclose a mortgage. (A.11465/S.8174)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of information technology and telecommunication to publish annually a public data directory.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of information technology and telecommunication to publish annually a public data directory.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on New York State to reduce the notification period required before the New York State Office of Child and Family Services is permitted to close a correctional facility.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Juvenile Justice
Items.MatterName: Reduce the notification period required before the NYS Office of Child and Family Services is permitted to close a correctional facility.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing paid family leave to private employees.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Providing paid family leave to private employees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to unlock doors between cars on New York City subway trains.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to unlock doors between cars on NYC subway trains.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that all newly manufactured taxicabs be accessible to people with disabilities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring that all newly manufactured taxicabs be accessible to people with disabilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to defining unrelated violations of vending rules and regulations as separate offenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Defining unrelated violations of vending rules and regulations as separate offenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing the maximum fine amount for violations of vending regulations and defining unrelated violations of vending rules and regulations as separate offenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Reducing the maximum fine amount for violations of vending regulations and defining unrelated violations of vending rules and regulations as separate offenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the alternative enforcement program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Alternative enforcement program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in seven business improvement districts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in 7 BIDS.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the Times Square, the Fifth Avenue Association, the Fashion Center, the HUB Third Avenue, the 125th Street, the Brighton Beach, and the Myrtle Avenue Brooklyn Business Improvement Districts, and the setting of the date, time and place for the hearing of the local law increasing the annual expenditure for such districts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Concerning the increase in the amount to be expended in 7 BIDS.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.4255, authorizing the New York State Departments of Health and Environmental Conservation to commission a study on the effects of exposure to long-term, low radiation emissions from cellular phone antennas on human beings, specifically adolescents.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Health and Environmental Conservation to commission a study on the effects of exposure to long-term, low radiation emissions from cellular phone antennas on human beings, specifically adolescents. (A.4255)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.4374, which would prohibit cellular towers or related equipment within five hundred feet of a school building in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibit cellular towers or related equipment within five hundred feet of a school building in NYC. (A.4374)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to reenter into negotiations with St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church in an effort to have the church rebuilt after being destroyed in the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Lower Manhattan Redevelopment
Items.MatterName: Reenter into negotiations with St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church in an effort to have the church rebuilt after being destroyed in the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass legislation that would make stalking by technological means illegal and increase the penalties for such acts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to pass legislation that would make stalking by technological means illegal and to increase the penalties for such acts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass legislation that would create a presumption that, when testifying at trial, an undercover police officer is endangered by his or her identity being made public, and would require the court to take all necessary measures to protect the officer’s identity.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to pass legislation that would create a presumption that, when testifying at trial, an undercover police officer is endangered by his or her identity being made public, and would require the court to take all necessary measures to protect

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Community impact reports for city-subsidized economic development projects.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Department of Health and Human Services to fully fund the Ryan White HIV/AIDS Program to allow provider and care networks to continue to combat the HIV/AIDS epidemic in New York City and across the nation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Department of Health and Human Services to fully fund the Ryan White HIV/AIDS Program.

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or Section 20-225 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 89 Greenwich Street, Community Board 2, Application 20115210 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 89 Greenwich Ave (20115210 TCM)

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or Section 20-225 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 39 Greenwich Avenue, Community Board 2, Application 20115218 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Café, 39 Greenwich Ave. (20115218 TCM)

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or Section 20-225 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 253 Washington Street, Community Board 2, Application 20115001 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Café, 753 Washington St, Manhattan (20115001TCM)

Items.MinutesNote: The President  Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)
The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera).
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 100452 HAM, an Urban Development Action Area Designation and Project, located at 535-537 East 11th Street, and the disposition of such property, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 2.  This matter is subject to Council Review and action pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter and Article 16 of the General Municipal Law.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 535-537 E. 11th St., Manhattan (C100452HAM)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Michael Devonshire to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the Landmarks Preservation Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 3020 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Michael Devonshire, Landmarks Preservation Commission

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) adjourned to meet again on Monday, December 20, 2010.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Application no. 20115218 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Wogie’s Inc. d.b.a Wogie’s Bar & Grill to continue to maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at  39 Greenwich Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3.
